text: Hi everyone, can Non-HubSpot forms accept and pass through all 5 UTMs? (content, term, campaign, source, medium)?
I would use the inspector in the browser to examine the broken image and see if you can determine the issue.
Would it be a global partial added to the theme base? or should I clone the existing theme template i'm using and add the partial to that? I'd like to maintain the DnD environment
Yeah, you can do it like that, however you’d like

Hey friends, working with the crm_objects hubl call, is there a way to get the fullname of an owner like you can with personalization tokens? I tried using `.fullname`
`.name`
`.full_name`
but nothings giving. I'm going to explore some secondary calls to lookup the name from the id, or worst worst case copy out the name via a formatter workflow action to a property, but I have like 2-3 owners to care about for each account so I don't want to do that if I don't have to.

Sweet. Thank you... I've set up the template and added the export to template, if the widget_data that i'm trying to pull is a choice field do I need to loop through the choices before using it as a parameter?

`{% set queryparam = "&orderBy=-priority&orderBy=last_name&board__contains=" ~ widget_data.member_type.value %}`
In this instance "New Car" should be being pulled through from the export to temp but it's not grabbing anything.
I would imagine they can provided you have an `<input>` to hold them. the only thing you run the risk of, if memory serves, is duplicate properties.
I’d look at developer info on the page, grab that json and put it into a pretty print site and make sure it is set up correctly and to ensure the data is being passed to the page
hmm I don't think I can help you here
yeah, you just need to set that up in your non HubSpot form to read that and place into the form

if you have a full name property you can bring that in

otherwise you would combine first and last name properties

fair enough, would be nice for these owner-type properties to output more like an object within the crm_objects call, so we could get more juices outta them apples. Thanks <@U25PYL3Q8> <@U06AG55U4G6> sounds like you've saved the day!
might want to look at graphql as an option, not sure if there is any difference, but could be worth looking at
AFAIK HubSpot doesn’t have a “full name”-property by default, but distinct “first name” and “last name”
